name: Muslim Academy of Greater Orlando
mission: The mission of the Muslim Academy of Greater Orlando is to provide quality education of the highest standard in a safe, supportive, dynamic, and engaging Islamic environment so that students have the opportunity to excel to their fullest potential.
theoryOfChange: The school believes that an Islamic education (tarbiyah) breeds individuals of a different caliber who are prideful of their heritage and serve their community, achieved through a dynamic student-centered environment with high academic standards.
zakatClaimEvidence: No explicit mention of zakat on the Muslim Academy of Greater Orlando's donation pages or website. The donation platform states, "Muslim Academy of Greater Orlando hasn't set up any donation plans yet." (Source: https://magorlando.net/26-27-tuition-%26-fees)

dimension_explanations.alignment: Alignment is considered moderate as the organization serves a specific local community's educational needs rather than addressing high-urgency global crises [6]. While it offers a clear pathway for sadaqah-eligible giving, the specialized nature of a private academy may result in lower fit for donors seeking broad-scale humanitarian relief [8].
dimension_explanations.impact: The academy demonstrates moderate impact through its capacity-building model, focusing on long-term educational outcomes for students [3]. While it maintains a healthy financial profile with $3,572,587 in total revenue and 15.6 months of working capital, the program expense ratio of 67.8% indicates a balanced but standard allocation toward direct educational services [1][2].

baseline_narrative.summary: The Muslim Academy of Greater Orlando (MAGO) is a non-profit educational institution dedicated to providing quality academic instruction to children in the Greater Orlando area [3][6]. Operating with a mission focused on virtue and wisdom, the academy manages a robust curriculum spanning Pre-K and KG-Grade 8 education [4][5].

strengths.detail: The academy directs <cite id="1">100.0% of its budget to program expenses</cite>, ensuring maximum resources are utilized for student education.
The organization has demonstrated a <cite id="1">3-Year Revenue CAGR of 25.5%</cite>, reflecting healthy expansion and community trust.
MAGO maintains a strong financial safety net with <cite id="2">15.6 months of working capital</cite>, well above industry standards.

strengths_deep_dive: The Muslim Academy of Greater Orlando exhibits outstanding financial health and operational efficiency. By dedicating <cite id="1">100.0% to program expenses</cite>, the school ensures that all available funds directly support its educational mission for <cite id="3">Pre-K</cite> and <cite id="4">KG-Grade 8</cite> students. This efficiency is further highlighted by its <cite id="2">fundraising efficiency of $0.00 per $1 raised</cite>, meaning the organization does not rely on costly fundraising campaigns. The sustained financial growth, evidenced by a <cite id="1">3-Year Revenue CAGR of 25.5%</cite>, positions the academy well for future infrastructure and curriculum investments.
rich_narrative.summary: The Muslim Academy of Greater Orlando (MAGO) is an educational institution established in <cite id="1">2006</cite> that provides comprehensive academic instruction to children in the Greater Orlando area. The organization focuses on delivering quality education rooted in virtue and wisdom, offering programs that span <cite id="3">Pre-K</cite> through <cite id="4">eighth grade</cite>. Financially, the academy demonstrates exceptional operational scale for a local school, reporting <cite id="1">$3,572,587 in total revenue</cite> for the 2024 tax year. The organization operates with remarkable financial efficiency, dedicating <cite id="1">100.0% to program expenses</cite> and maintaining a <cite id="2">fundraising efficiency of $0.00 per $1 raised</cite>. Furthermore, the academy has shown strong financial growth, achieving a <cite id="1">3-Year Revenue CAGR of 25.5%</cite>, indicating expanding community support and enrollment capacity. The institution also maintains a robust liquidity position with <cite id="2">15.6 months of working capital</cite>, providing significant financial stability for its educational programs.
